result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

BOND TO COVER 22CM558, 22CT513, 22CM385 & 22CT345

DEFENDANT MUST POST $500 CASH. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Saul Arteaga

Called at 1:39 pm. Defendant Maylon Onel Fajardo Lopez in court, in custody by video.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Josh Ryan appeared for defendant. Interpreter Saul Arteaga previously sworn by clerk. Attorney Ryan reads charges and penalties in to the record as to both files. Copy of 22CM558 given to Attorney. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved for 22CM558 & 22CT513. State will amend complaint in CT file to reflect correct offense date. Discussion as to bond, total bond set, $10000 signature with $500 cash component. Prior bond forfeited. Dates canceled before Commissioner Navis. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Maylon Onel Fajardo Lopez in court, in custody via video.  Attorney Josh Ryan for Attorney Jason Mitchel Daane in court for Maylon Onel Fajardo Lopez.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reset matters due to no spanish interpreter. Minutes filed.
Further proceedings scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Further proceedings scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
